intro: Commelina sulcatisperma, commonly known as the grooved-fruit commelina, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the Commelinaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers and elongated, ribbed seed capsules. Its leaves are typically broad and lance-shaped, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Commelina sulcatisperma thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks.
